poem:
Title: "Titanic Ties"

Beneath boardrooms' gilded roofs, the Roundtable plots,
Two-hundred CEOs in whispering knots.
Eight figures promised, weighing heavy on tongues,
Their measures of responsibility strung.
In the cradle of commerce, 'ol Trump plays nurse,
Invisible hands nurturing the corporate purse.
A silent choir of tax reforms they recite,
For in their ledger books, they rewrite the night.
